attributes.title: Discover joy inside yourself Bhagavad Gita by Nithyananda
attributes.description:
(2012 - Get prepared for the conscious cosmic transition - details at events/2012-get-prepared-conscious-cosmic-transition-global-event)

 Bhagavad Gita (Song of God) is a timeless treatise on the essence of living enlightenment. The Gita was imparted by the enlightened Hindu incarnation Sri Krishna to the warrior-prince Arjuna over 5000 years ago. Amazingly, the spiritual wisdom and life solutions offered in the Gita are so universal and current that it is even today used as a personal transformation guide

In this talk on Bhagavad Gita, Chap 2, Verse 58, Paramahamsa Nithyananda shares his personal experience with Sri Krishna's message.  The verse instructs us that when we withdraw our senses from outward stimuli in the same way that a tortoise withdraws into its shell, our spiritual understanding becomes steady. Paramahamsa recalls grasping this concept strongly upon first seeing a tortoise in action as a boy. He comments that the clarity of Sri Krishna's image is so sharp it needs no embellishment. When we transform our awareness and focus on our inner space, we discover that the source of all joy lies within ourselves. We accept our evolutionary destiny: to end our dependence on external events. This does not mean we don't interact or enjoy the outer world, but it no longer disturbs our stability
